questions.question: What does a stop sign indicate?
options: You must come to a complete stop
questions.correctAnswer: You must come to a complete stop
questions.explanation: A stop sign means that you must come to a complete stop before proceeding.

questions.question: What does a yield sign represent?
options: You must slow down and let others go first if necessary
questions.correctAnswer: You must slow down and let others go first if necessary
questions.explanation: A yield sign means you must slow down and yield the right-of-way to traffic in the intersection you are crossing or roadway you are entering.

questions.question: What does a red light signal mean?
options: Speed up and clear the intersection
questions.explanation: A red light signal means that you must come to a complete stop.

questions.question: What does a green traffic light mean?
questions.explanation: A green light signal means you may go if the way is clear.

questions.question: What does a flashing yellow light mean?
questions.explanation: A flashing yellow light means you may proceed with caution.

questions.question: What does a double yellow line represent?
options: You can pass if the way is clear
You can only pass if you are on a motorcycle
You can only pass during daylight hours
questions.explanation: A double yellow line in the center of a two-lane road means passing is not allowed for both directions of traffic.

questions.question: What does a white line parallel to your lane indicate?
questions.explanation: A white line parallel to your lane on the road means that you are allowed to change lanes.

questions.question: What does a red arrow signal mean?
options: You can turn in the direction of the arrow
You cannot turn in the direction of the arrow
You must yield before turning in the direction of the arrow
You must stop and then proceed when safe
questions.correctAnswer: You cannot turn in the direction of the arrow
questions.explanation: A red arrow signal means you cannot turn in the direction of the arrow until the signal changes.

questions.question: What does a yellow diamond-shaped sign indicate?
questions.explanation: A yellow diamond-shaped sign is a warning sign and indicates potential hazards or changing road conditions ahead.

questions.question: What does a rectangular white sign indicate?
questions.explanation: A rectangular white sign indicates a regulation or law, such as speed limits or no parking zones.

questions.question: At an intersection without a stop or yield sign, who has the right of way?
questions.explanation: At an intersection without a stop or yield sign, the driver on the right has the right of way.

questions.question: At a four-way stop, who has the right of way?
questions.explanation: At a four-way stop, the driver who stops first has the right of way.

questions.question: Who has the right of way when turning at a green traffic signal?
questions.explanation: Pedestrians have the right of way at traffic signals unless otherwise directed by signs.

questions.question: When merging onto a highway, who has the right of way?
options: The vehicle that is going faster
The vehicle that is going slower
questions.explanation: The vehicles already on the highway have the right of way over the vehicles merging.

questions.question: Who has the right of way at a pedestrian crosswalk?
questions.explanation: Pedestrians have the right of way at crosswalks.
